content.description: Start on a ramp and chase bolts up the overhanging face.  Fun moves!
content.location: This is in the center of the east-facing wall.

content.description: Follow a black streak of overhanging rock up and to the right.  Pumpy!
content.location:
This is the first route around the corner from

Spayed in the Shade

(10c) and directly to the right of

Heebie Jeebie

(11c).

content.description: The climbing follows bolts on the left side of the east-facing wall.  It has a crux halfway up on slopey ledges.
content.location: This is on the left side of the east-facing wall, behind the tree.

content.description: This has a fun crux at 3rd bolt getting through the roof to steep climbing above.
content.location:
This is 10 feet right of

No Begging!

Look for first low bolt on the slab.

content.description: Climb through a blocky section to start to fun, steep climbing on great incuts.  It is a good warmup for harder routes in the area.
content.location: This is the furthest bolted route to the left of the cliff.

content.description: This is located around the right hand side of the cliff. Climb to a shelf, then follow bolts right to a fun, overhanging section on great holds.
Climb the right side of the arete on the east-facing side of the cliff.  The crux is at the 3rd bolt pulling onto the ramp.
content.protection: 3 bolts and chain anchors. The first bolt is high, but the climbing is easy to get to it.

content.description: Climb shallow dihedrals to a tricky crux under the roof.
content.protection:
4 bolts.  It shares anchors with

Jeepers Creepers

.
content.location:
This starts just right of

Jeepers Creepers

.

content.description: Clip the first bolt using the pedestal block to the right, and then proceed to crank through a couple of fun moves to a ledgy stance.  Move up and then left through some good edges and flake-type jugs to the anchors.
content.protection: Five bolts to a two-bolt anchor.
content.location:
This is the first route located after a break in the cliff to the right and uphill from "

Kung Pao Kitty

".

content.description: A wild start leads to great steep face climbing and one more roof at the top to anchors.  Crux comes getting through the 5th bolt (tough clip).  Cruxy moves above the first bolt and then over the roof to the anchors keep things interesting the whole way.  Super route!
content.protection: 7 bolts (guidebook says 6.  This is WRONG!), shuts.
content.location: It is in the center of the main Upper Bulldog Wall.

content.description: Climb up to the ledge below the roof on easy terrain and clip the first bolt.  Pull through the crux roof to reach the "fang" and clip the 2nd bolt.  A fun series of sidepulls and pinches gets you to the anchors from there.
content.location: This is 15 feet right of Shock Collar.  Look for the first bolt just over the roof (which can be reached to clip from the ledge).

content.description: This includes a slight overhang and some face climbing. It is short.
content.location: This is the third climb from the right/top of the crag.

content.description:
Preclip the first bolt at the lip of the roof, and climb the right side of the arete shared with

Jeepers Creepers

. Reach around to clip the second bolt, then sack up to traverse left around the arete and across the black face to bolt 3, which is about a foot higher than you want it to be. There is real potential to get f#@*ed up if you blow the clip. If you have a long stickclip, prehanging a longish draw on the third bolt would add a lot more security. From there, hang tough for a few more cranks on spiny holds to reach bolt 4. The climbing to the top is easier but dirty and hard to read, with another committing move to reach the chains.
content.protection: Four bolts and a chain anchor. A long stickclip is useful.
content.location:
The first bolts are located immediately left of the arete shared with

Jeepers Creepers

. The route climbs left and up from the arete through the middle of the black face.

content.description: This is a short but fun route.
